title: Reduced Tillage Systems for Organic Vegetable Production

tasks.task: Conducting research on reduced tillage systems for organic vegetable production.
subtasks: Discussing project goals and funding.
Describing cover crop seeding (rye and vetch).
Explaining cover crop termination using a roller crimper.
Detailing the three whole plot treatments (no-till, strip-till, conventional till).
Describing nitrogen fertilization strategies for two subplots.
Presenting early yield and groundwater nitrate leaching data.
Comparing weed management between tillage methods.

tasks.task: Operating farming equipment for cover crop management.
subtasks: Using a roller crimper to terminate cover crops.
Attaching U-bolts to the strip tiller for effective rye killing.
Using a strip tiller for fall and pre-plant weed control, fertilizer delivery.
Planting organic broccoli and peppers in no-till and strip-till plots.
Performing in-season weed control without mechanical cultivation.
Applying nitrogen fertilizers using a side-dressing unit.
